item.title: ASOC-47: Project needs Fragment tests and error/validation error detection
item.description:
Reporter Rob Williams (rob)
Created May 23, 2014 7:40:56 AM
Updated Jul 14, 2014 7:40:34 AM
Resolved Jul 14, 2014 7:40:34 AM
Priority Normal
Type Task
State Fixed
Assignee Rob Williams (rob)
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 0.6.0
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
There is very little out there on testing Fragments. Frankly, I want to make a harness and test them in isolation. Just collecting all logical and flow problems in one big Activity test is not a great approach. When that test breaks, it will be hell to fix. Furthermore, Fragments can be used in many places so their logic should already be tested and proven and if we go to use a Fragment somewhere, we should be able to read tests of just that Fragment.

Here is one of the only things I could find written about testing Fragments, not that great, but his checking for validation errors, etc. is good. Would be better though if that was done in sub methods so it was not polluting the readability of the test itself.

Post on testing Fragments in Android

item.description:
Reporter Nikolay Chorniy (nikolay.chorniy@gmail.com)

Fix versions 0.4.0

Fixed in build Next Build
Here is the example of the problem.

Successful response on authentication request returns "user" item with "history" > "capsules" array in which each item is a full description of a capsule:

{
 "access_token": {
 "id": "53a05f793e1536723a06039e",
 "user": {
 "history": {
 "capsules": [
 {
 "contributors": [""],
 "id": "53850eaa04e5fdfc7db22dc4",
 ...
 },
 {
 ...
 } 
 ]
 }

 }
}, 
}

Response for user profile information returns "history" > "capsules" JSON object which is an array of plain strings.

GET
http://stagingvixletapi-env.elasticbeanstalk.com/user/profile/id/53850d9a04e5fdfc7db22db7?subscribe=1&access_token=eme8NLEgOkIGBMO7y3DYgXIAT4FV1EScz7r10SyTmPfKUUYsqFWb2OEpdFehmF33GDR4sfSnfDipcZpjdUFtJx7yoXAHmzwKNTxhs38CBLUEiYhPOWthQNn9FiKBMbnIxgrt8Mc7f9QoLDyOrB0KEVOlQIHEHWwhpGm6WnIdYjO5xXus7Qw8KYejGjCYBZjJWFUgYo117Q4mWmgnc2xm8kn5mwMAQtmZaCJaZUNTEXhN7MfYzBF4mNzd2fdRlz6I


{"data": {
 "history": {
 "capsules": [
 "5386278ab23058671656dbe9", 
 "5385476e04e5fdfc7db22e08", 
 "5392703b64455e0000060034", 
 "5392658764455e0000060032", 
 "53850dbc04e5fdfc7db22db9", 
 "538520ef4f9b9849322c1b58"
 ]
 },
 ...
}}

Since we are using Jackson to easily map JSON to Java objects, we get an exception in parsing of the second response (since it expects array of JSON objects like in the first type of response but not array of plain strings like in the second type of response). If the second response would have this format

{"data": {
 "history": {
 "capsules": [
 {"id": "5386278ab23058671656dbe9"}, 
 {"id": "5385476e04e5fdfc7db22e08"}, 
 ...
 ]
 },
 ...
}}

then we would not have problems in parsing it. @pawan, @timfulmer is it possible to rework the format of user profile response this way and fix all other similar "problems" so that we would not have to create different parsers / JSON mappings for each request?

This is for optimization of capsule editing (see ASOC-38).

When user taps "Edit" button on capsule details screen, application loads capsule details from the server. In case if view and/or contributor rules are set to "From List", then we have to load names of all users who are configured as viewers / contributors of the capsule.

At the moment we load each user profile in a different HTTP request:

GET
http://stagingvixletapi-env.elasticbeanstalk.com/user/profile/id/53850d9a04e5fdfc7db22db7?subscribe=1&access_token=eme8NLEgOkIGBMO7y3DYgXIAT4FV1EScz7r10SyTmPfKUUYsqFWb2OEpdFehmF33GDR4sfSnfDipcZpjdUFtJx7yoXAHmzwKNTxhs38CBLUEiYhPOWthQNn9FiKBMbnIxgrt8Mc7f9QoLDyOrB0KEVOlQIHEHWwhpGm6WnIdYjO5xXus7Qw8KYejGjCYBZjJWFUgYo117Q4mWmgnc2xm8kn5mwMAQtmZaCJaZUNTEXhN7MfYzBF4mNzd2fdRlz6I

So if there are 5 different viewers / contributors of the capsule, we will have to execute 1 + 5 HTTP requests for loading capsule details and 5 user profiles appropriately. It would be faster if there is

  • 1 + 1 HTTP requests (capsule details + all user profiles in one request) or even
  • 1 HTTP request (capsule details will contain profile information for each viewer and contributor, at least their user name)

@pawan, @timfulmer, is there an API to load profile information of several users in one HTTP request?
